sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A table briefly pointing out such places of Scripture, as either plainely or by good consequence condemne the principall points of popery; gathered by I.VV. for the use and benefit of God's people Breefe of Scripture, disproving the principall points of popery Waker, John.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed, [London] : anno Domnini M.D.C.XXV. [1625]
I.W. = John Waker. The roman numeral date is made with turned C's. Place of publication from STC. Previously published in Dublin, 1624, as "A breefe of Scripture, disproving the principall points of popery". Identified as STC 24907 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1475-1640", reel 1044. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
